Violation_Type: Failure to consider cumulative effect of discriminatory acts
Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in failing to consider the cumulative effect of discriminatory acts in assessing well-founded fear of persecution
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), particularly sections relating to refugee protection and well-founded fear of persecution
Application_Facts: Mr. Mete, a Christian convert, claimed persecution in Turkey due to his religious beliefs; presented credible testimony and evidence of harm to Christians
Decision_Outcome: RPD decision rejected due to legal error
Court_Ruling: RPD erred in law by not applying the cumulative test for persecution; decision set aside
Claimant_Status: Christian convert from Turkey seeking refugee status
Defendant_Behavior: RPD focused on isolated incidents rather than cumulative impact of discrimination
Grounds_for_Claim: Religious persecution based on conversion to Christianity
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution includes cumulative effects of discriminatory or harmful acts
Assessment_Factor: Cumulative impact of discriminatory acts against Mr. Mete
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative decision by the Refugee Protection Division (RPD)
Evidence_Used: Testimony of Mr. Mete, evidence of treatment of Christian converts in Turkey
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 and Section 97 of IRPA regarding Convention refugee definition
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution on grounds of religion
Evidence_Assessed: Credible evidence of systemic discrimination and risk to Christian converts in Turkey
Relief_Sought: Recognition as a Convention refugee, redetermination of claim
Governing_Rule: Persecution may arise from cumulative effect of repeated discriminatory acts or harassment
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD failed to adequately analyze cumulative impact despite available evidence
Outcome: Decision set aside, remitted to a new panel for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of serious harm due to religious identity as a Christian convert in Turkey
Cause_Description: Mr. Mete claimed refugee status due to religious persecution in Turkey as a Christian convert. His claim was rejected by the RPD.
Evidence_Handling: Evidence was presented but not properly synthesized in cumulative analysis
Legal_Provision_Violated: Failure to apply correct legal standard under IRPA s. 96 regarding persecution
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient consideration of documentary and testimonial evidence on cumulative basis
Legal_Provision: IRPA, s. 96 - Definition of Convention refugee
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence of individual incidents acknowledged but not assessed collectively
Decision_Rationale: The RPD must assess whether the cumulative effect of discriminatory conduct amounts to persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of cumulative analysis despite presence of credible evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution including cumulative harm
